questionsData.title: Vaccination helps to prevent infection by the same disease.
questionsData.explain_answer:
Vaccines work by exposing your body to a weakened or inactive form of a virus or bacteria. This triggers your immune system to develop antibodies that can fight off the real disease if you encounter it later. 

diseases are spread by germs.and vaccination using a very weak form of the disease could lead to immunity.

questionsData.title: Modern drugs do not help to control AIDS.
Protection against a disease is called immunity.
Breakthrough is a sudden discovery.
. A disease found only in cattle is cowpox
. AIDS developed from the blood of monkeys
A development is the end result of a rapid process.
questionsData.explain_answer: Development can happen slowly over time or quickly through rapid processes. Not all development requires speed.

questionsData.title: Doctors first treat the illness before diagnosing it.
Diseases are cured before they are treated.
questionsData.explain_answer:
Diseases are treated before they are cured .

The terms "cure" and "treat" are related to medical or therapeutic interventions, but they have distinct meanings:

Treat: This is the first step, where scientists and doctors recognize a new illness or condition.

Example:

  • Treating a bacterial infection with antibiotics.

Cure: A cure completely eliminates the disease from the body.

Example :

  • Smallpox eradicated by widespread vaccination.

questionsData.title: AIDS does not affect people.
In the past the idea of vaccination was common.
A vaccine for smallpox is common these days.
Cowpox is a disease that affects cattle.
A vaccine is a weak form of a disease.
A weak form of the disease leads to immunity.
Cowpox only found in monkeys.
People working with cows suffered from smallpox.
Diseases are the end result of infection by germs.
AIDS came from African monkeys.
Vaccination is giving a weak form of a disease to spread a disease.
questionsData.explain_answer:
Vaccination is giving a weak form of a disease  to prevent  a disease.

Vaccines work by exposing your body to a weakened or inactive form of a virus or bacteria. This triggers your immune system to develop antibodies that can fight off the real disease if you encounter it later. 

diseases are spread by germs.and vaccination using a very weak form of the disease could lead to immunity.
